00036 #include "PACC/Threading/Thread.hpp"
00037 #include "PACC/Util/Assert.hpp"
00038 #include "PACC/config.hpp"
00039 #include <cstdlib>
00040 
00041 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00042 #include <windows.h>
00043 #define ErrNo WSAGetLastError() // descriptor of last error
00044 struct ThreadStruct {
00045     HANDLE mHandle;
00046     DWORD mId;
00047 };
00048 
00049 #else // Unix...
00050 #include <pthread.h>
00051 #include <unistd.h>
00052 #include <sys/errno.h>
00053 #define ErrNo errno // descriptor of last error
00054 typedef pthread_t ThreadStruct;
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 using namespace PACC;
00058 
00063 Threading::Thread::Thread(void) : mThread(0), mCancel(false), mRunning(false) {}
00064 
00082 Threading::Thread::~Thread(void)
00083 {
00084     lock();
00085     if(mThread) {
00086         // make sure that thread is no longer running
00087         PACC_AssertM(!mRunning, "Destructor called without first cancelling the thread and waiting for its termination. Please correct the situation because it is potentially very hazardous!");
00088         // detach thread
00089         ThreadStruct* lThread = (ThreadStruct*) mThread;
00090 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00091         if(::WaitForSingleObject(lThread->mHandle, INFINITE) == WAIT_FAILED)
00092 #else // Unix...
00093         if(::pthread_join(*lThread, 0) != 0)
00094 #endif
00095         {
00096             throw Exception(ErrNo, "Thread::~Thread() unable to join thread");
00097         }
00098         // delete native structure
00099         delete lThread;
00100         mThread = 0;
00101     }
00102     unlock();
00103 }
00104 
00111 void Threading::Thread::cancel(void)
00112 {
00113     mCancel = true;
00114 }
00115 
00120 bool Threading::Thread::isRunning(void) const
00121 {
00122     return mRunning;
00123 }
00124 
00126 bool Threading::Thread::isSelf(void) const
00127 {
00128     ThreadStruct* lThread = (ThreadStruct*) mThread;
00129 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00130     return lThread->mId == ::GetCurrentThreadId();
00131 #else // Unix...
00132 #ifdef pthread_equal
00133     // On AIX, pthread_equal is defined as a macro.
00134     return pthread_equal(*lThread, ::pthread_self());
00135 #else // pthread_equal
00136     return ::pthread_equal(*lThread, ::pthread_self());
00137 #endif // pthread_equal
00138 #endif
00139 }
00140 
00145 void Threading::Thread::makeCancellationPoint(void)
00146 {
00147     lock();
00148     // exit thread if cancellation was requested
00149     if(mCancel) {
00150         // signal all that thread has terminated
00151         mRunning = false;
00152         broadcast();
00153         unlock();
00154         // now exit thread
00155 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00156         ::ExitThread(0);
00157 #else // Unix...
00158         ::pthread_exit(0);
00159 #endif
00160     }
00161     unlock();
00162 }
00163 
00170 void Threading::Thread::run(void)
00171 {
00172     lock();
00173     // check that thread is not already running
00174     if(mRunning) {
00175         unlock();
00176         throw Exception(eRunning, "Thread::run() thread is already running!");
00177     }
00178     mCancel = false;
00179     // allocate native structure
00180     if(!mThread) mThread = new ThreadStruct;
00181     ThreadStruct* lThread = (ThreadStruct*) mThread;
00182     // create thread
00183 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00184     if((lThread->mHandle = ::CreateThread(0, 0, (LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE)startup, this, 0, &lThread->mId)) == 0)
00185 #else // Unix
00186     if(::pthread_create(lThread, 0, startup, this) != 0)  
00187 #endif
00188     {
00189         unlock();
00190         throw Exception(eOtherError, "Thread::run() can't create thread!");
00191     }
00192     // wait for thread to start up
00193     if(!mRunning) Condition::wait();
00194     unlock();
00195 }
00196 
00201 void Threading::Thread::sleep(double inSeconds)
00202 {
00203     if(inSeconds < 0) throw Exception(eOtherError, "Thread::sleep() invalid time");
00204 #ifdef PACC_THREADS_WIN32
00205     // argument must be in milliseconds for windows
00206     ::Sleep((DWORD)(1000*inSeconds));
00207 #else // Unix...
00208     if(inSeconds < 1000) {
00209         // use microsecond sleep
00210         if(::usleep((unsigned int)(1000000*inSeconds)) != 0) {
00211             throw Exception(eOtherError, "Thread::sleep() can't sleep");
00212         }
00213     } else {
00214         // use regular sleep
00215         if(::sleep((unsigned int)(inSeconds)) != 0) {
00216             throw Exception(eOtherError, "Thread::sleep() can't sleep");
00217         }
00218     }
00219 #endif
00220 }
00221 
00226 void* Threading::Thread::startup(void* inThread)
00227 {
00228     Thread* lThread = (Thread*) inThread;
00229     // signal parent thread that this thread is starting to run
00230     lThread->lock();
00231     lThread->mRunning = true;
00232     lThread->signal();
00233     lThread->unlock();
00234     // execute main
00235     lThread->main();
00236     // signal all that thread as terminated
00237     lThread->lock();
00238     lThread->mRunning = false;
00239     lThread->broadcast();
00240     lThread->unlock();
00241     return 0;
00242 }
00243 
00250 void Threading::Thread::wait(bool inLock)
00251 {
00252     if(inLock) lock();
00253     if(mRunning) Condition::wait();
00254     if(inLock) unlock();
00255 }
